item.title: Ticket #9998 (cURL DNS Lookup timeout; Plugin and Update Download Fail) created
item.dc:creator: carltonbale
item.description:
This is an intermittent problem that seems to have been introduced in 2.7.1. The plugin browser works properly but plugin upgrades and installs do not. The following error message results: "Download failed.: name lookup timed out"

Two work-arounds have been identified. One is to add "72.233.56.139 downloads.wordpress.org" to the "/etc/hosts" file. The other is to disable cURL using the "Core Control" plugin ( ​http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/core-control/ ) after activating the "HTTP Access Module 0.6" within Core Control.

The Core Control HTTP Access Module allows for testing of cURL. When the test is run, the following error message results: "An Error has occured: name lookup timed out"

When cURL is disabled in this module, plugin updates work properly due to reverting to an alternative method.

The issue has occurred on the following configurations: Apache version 2.2.6 and 2.2.8 PHP version 5.2.5 and 5.2.9 MySQL version 4.1.22 and 5.0.41 Operating system: Linux Here are links to posts discussing the problem in the forums: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/231500?replies=5#post-948036

​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/225535?replies=9

​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/225437?replies=13

item.title: Ticket #9989 (1&1 and Wordpress 2.8) updated
item.dc:creator: robertaccettura
item.description:
I'm not sure a theme or plugin should ever really be using allow_url_include as it's inherently very insecure and thus *should* be disabled on secure systems. Including from a remote source is extremely risky. If the remote source is compromised it can include bad code injecting anything from spam to other malware onto the host server (since it would have all permissions that wordpress and php have).

Perhaps to help kill this harmful practice the following should be added to wp-settings.php: 

ini_set('allow_url_include', 'Off')

A theme can in theory just turn it back on, but hopefully this will at least discourage the behavior for less experienced developers.

item.title: Ticket #9990 (Anti-nofollow plugins do not work in WP v2.7.1) created
item.dc:creator: IndigoJo
item.description:
I want to disable "nofollow" in my comments, because spam filtering makes it unnecessary. However, I have tried a number of plugins including Nofollow-free, DoFollow and Lucia's Linky Love, and none of them have any effect. I have tried replacing my theme (Atahualpa v3.3.3) with the default Kubrick-based one, and the nofollow still appears.

There should be an option to disable this, or else it should be disabled by default. Nofollow belongs to the era before spam filtering and is not necessary on either spam-filtered or moderated blogs.
